channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

image.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition

channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2020 Turner Broadcasting System, Inc. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: Joe Biden rips 'despicable' Trump for invoking George Floyd during speech about economy
Minneapolis city council votes to ban chokeholds by police
Melania Trump's messaging frustrating the West Wing, source says
Fox asked Trump about police violence. Here's what he said.
item.description: CNN's Don Lemon says that when President Donald Trump was asked by Fox News radio what to do about police violence against people of color, the president made the answer all about himself.

item.title: Confirmed coronavirus cases rising faster than ever
Covid-19 hospitalizations nearly double across New York City
This is exactly how far Trump will go to hear a packed crowd cheer for him
See what Rio de Janeiro's world-famous beach looks like now
item.description: Covid-19 has emptied Copacabana beach in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil. CNN's Nick Paton Walsh reports on the deserted seafront.

item.title: 2 officers suspended after video shows 75-year-old man pushed to ground during protest
item.description: Two police officers in Buffalo, New York, were suspended without pay Thursday after video showed them pushing a 75-year-old man, causing him to fall back and hit his head on the sidewalk, Buffalo Police Department spokesman Mike DeGeorge told CNN.

item.title: Republican senator holds up anti-lynching bill. See Harris and Booker's response.
item.description: Sen. Rand Paul (R-KY) explains why he is holding up popular bipartisan legislation to make lynching a federal crime. Sen. Kamala Harris (D-CA) and Sen. Cory Booker (D-NJ) take to the floor to respond.

item.title: Student raped and killed in church wanted to become a minister and 'preach the word of God,' sister says
CNN Poll of Polls finds Biden leading Trump
The world creeps close to a dangerous climate threshold
item.description: Last month was the hottest May on record worldwide, a European climate agency has reported, with temperatures in Siberia rising 10 degrees Celsius (18 degrees Fahrenheit) above their normal levels.

item.title: US pulls back on threat to block Chinese flights
item.description: US authorities are pulling back on their threat to block Chinese airlines from flying into the US after the Chinese government changed its own policy.

item.title: Women are being killed in Mexico at record rates, but president says most emergency calls are 'false'
item.description: Women are being murdered in Mexico at an alarming rate, but the nation's president has downplayed a surge in calls to emergency hotlines, declaring most of them are false.

item.title: Gulf Coast on alert: Where Cristobal may make landfall in the US
item.description: The Gulf Coast has all eyes on Cristobal, with the storm's strength and where it might hit likely to become clearer by Saturday morning.

item.title: Porn star arrested after man dies during 'mystical' toad venom ritual
item.description: Spanish porn star Nacho Vidal is under investigation for manslaughter, after a man died during a ceremony involving toad venom.

item.title: German tourists fined $790 for swimming in Venice's Grand Canal
item.description: A pair of German tourists who swam in Venice's Grand Canal have been fined $790 and removed from the city, Italian police told CNN Friday.

item.title: He quit his Facebook job because of Zuckerberg's inaction on Trump's posts
LeBron James calls out Fox News host Laura Ingraham for defense of Drew Brees
item.description: NBA star LeBron James has called out Fox News host Laura Ingraham for her defense of star quarterback Drew Brees.

item.title: Dutch PM has 'major changes' in opinion on blackface -- but he's not going to ban it
item.description: The Dutch Prime Minister has said his views on the national tradition of dressing in blackface to portray the character of "Zwarte Piet," or Black Pete, have undergone "major changes" -- but he won't go as far as banning it.

item.title: Breonna Taylor would have been 27 today. Here's where her case stands.
item.description: On June 5, Breonna Taylor would have been 27 years old. But she was killed two months ago when police broke down the door to her apartment in an attempted drug sting, and shot her eight times.

item.title: Ahmaud Arbery's mother says last moments of his life were heartbreaking
item.description: Among those who learned more about Ahmaud Arbery's death at a preliminary hearing on Thursday was his mother, who called the revelations heartbreaking.

item.title: See George Floyd tribute painted in an unexpected place
item.description: Street artists from Manchester, England, to Syria are honoring George Floyd in their own colorful ways by painting murals to express solidarity with the African-American community in the US.

item.title: Trump campaign removes space-themed ad amid complaints from former astronaut, others
item.description: President Donald Trump's re-election campaign pulled a space-themed ad from YouTube Thursday after complaints were raised that it violated NASA guidelines and at least one former astronaut objected to appearing in it without her consent.

item.title: 9-year-old Kenyan wins presidential award for building wooden handwashing machine
item.description: A 9-year-old Kenyan boy who made a wooden hand washing machine to limit the spread of Covid-19 received a presidential award on Monday.

item.title: 'You sound deranged': Piers Morgan and Rudy Giuliani interview goes off-the-rails
item.description: On "Good Morning Britain" host Piers Morgan got in a verbal altercation with former New York City mayor Rudy Giuliani.

item.title: Seven people found dead in burning home
item.description: Authorities in Alabama are investigating the deaths of seven adults found in a home near Huntsville on Thursday night, the Morgan County Sheriff's Department says.

item.title: Three Chinese nationals sentenced to prison for taking photos at Florida naval base
item.description: Three Chinese nationals were sentenced to prison Thursday for entering a restricted area at a naval base in Key West, Florida, to take photos.

item.title: Hong Kong held a vigil that broke a government ban. See what it is like
item.description: Thousands in Hong Kong defied a police ban to gather in the city's Victoria Park and mark the 31st anniversary of the Tiananmen Square massacre. CNN's Ivan Watson reports.

item.title: Entire spa village on sale for $7 million
item.description: When the world is feeling just too much, imagine how great it would be to start afresh.

item.title: Cate Blanchett has cut her head with a chainsaw during lockdown -- but she's OK
item.description: Australian actress Cate Blanchett has said she cut her head with a chainsaw during an accident at home during lockdown.

item.title: Vegas casinos reopen with countdown and virtual fireworks
item.description: Las Vegas casinos are once again open for business after being closed for more than two months in an effort to slow the spread of coronavirus. CNN affiliate KLAS reports.

item.title: Tennis star charged with assaulting ex-wife
item.description: The ex-wife of a leading tennis player is standing by claims she was the victim of assault.

item.title: Sunken 1878 warship given protected status
item.description: The UK government has granted protected status to a wrecked German warship which sank off the British coast more than 140 years ago.

item.title: Actor Yvonne Orji no longer 'Insecure' about Nigerian-American duality
item.description: "Can I navigate home? This place that I call home? And if I can't, then is it really?"

item.title: Strawberry Moon 2020: Best times to watch
item.description: It's time for another noteworthy celestial event. Be sure to cast your gaze toward the sky for this year's Strawberry Moon.

item.title: Cristiano Ronaldo is the first football star to break $1 billion earnings milestone
item.description: Another day, another record broken by Cristiano Ronaldo.

item.title: Bruce Lee gets a fitting tribute, as 'Be Water' looks at Asians and Hollywood
item.description: Bruce Lee isn't an obvious fit for ESPN, beyond the fact lots of people enjoyed his action movies. Yet "Be Water" proves an excellent addition to the network's lineup of documentaries to fill the sports void, examining the martial-arts star's legacy and the circuitous, discrimination-marred path he followed to his too-short stardom.

item.title: The NBA has approved a plan to continue the season with 22 teams
item.description: The NBA's return is imminent -- but only with 22 teams.

item.title: Inside the oldest pencil company in the world
item.description: Faber-Castell makes some 2 billion pencils across 120 different colors every year. We took a look inside their factory.

item.title: How wild swimming saved my life
item.description: Preparing to jump out of the second-floor window and into the river below, I felt the acute sense that my anxiety was about to be washed away.

item.title: Dwayne Johnson makes powerful plea for leadership
item.description: Dwayne 'The Rock' Johnson took to social media to issue a plea for leadership as protests following the killing of George Floyd continue across the country.

item.title: Presumptive Democratic nominee says US President's comment 'tells you everything you need to know about this man and what he really cares about'
item.description: Former Vice President Joe Biden sharply criticized President Donald Trump for invoking George Floyd's name as the President was taking a victory lap over lower unemployment numbers.

item.title: Trump claims it's a 'great day' for Floyd in unwieldy speech
item.description: President Donald Trump invoked George Floyd's name during a Friday bill signing ceremony touting the latest jobs report, which exceeded economists' expectations.

item.title: Most outrageous lines from Trump's 'press conference'
item.description: Just before 9 a.m. Eastern time on Friday, President Donald Trump tweeted that he would be holding a "News Conference" to talk about the "Jobs Numbers!"

item.title: Melania's messaging frustrating the West Wing, source says
item.description: First lady Melania Trump's messaging in the wake of the killing of George Floyd and the resulting protests around the country has frustrated the West Wing, according to a White House official.

item.title: Retired general: I'm glad I don't have to advise Trump
item.description: Retired four-star Gen. Richard Myers said during an interview with CNN's Erin Burnett that he's "glad" he doesn't have to advise President Donald Trump as the President threatens to use the military if violent protests continue.

item.title: Confirmed Covid-19 cases rising faster than ever
item.description: LIVE UPDATES: Covid-19 hospitalizations nearly double across New York City Peruvians cry out for oxygen as coronavirus takes its toll

item.title: This is exactly how far Trump will go to hear a packed crowd cheering for him
item.description: CNN Poll of Polls: Biden leads Trump White House turns press corps into anti-social distancing props
